diff_hunk:
@@ -200,7 +200,9 @@ def tmp(t):
     ('mode', small_3d, lambda t: [],),
     ('mode', small_3d, lambda t: [1], 'dim'),

+    ('remainder', small_3d, lambda t: [-3], 'negative_value'),

body:
So if you have the `0 - x` it works fine for me as well, which is why I put it like this in the tests, so that they run.
The problem is if I try to use the unary version of the `-` operator, (so just ` - x`) I get the AttributeError that the `neg` function hasn't been implemented.
body_html:
So if you have the 0 - x it works fine for me as well, which is why I put it like this in the tests, so that they run.
The problem is if I try to use the unary version of the - operator, (so just - x) I get the AttributeError that the neg function hasn't been implemented.
body_text:
So if you have the 0 - x it works fine for me as well, which is why I put it like this in the tests, so that they run.
The problem is if I try to use the unary version of the - operator, (so just  - x) I get the AttributeError that the neg function hasn't been implemented.
